hero.title:
Design faster in Figma.
Ship better products
hero.description: The Figma plugin suite for designers, developers, and marketers who care about speed, structure, and creativity. Automate audits, renaming, cleanup, and project setup so teams ship in sync.

features.title: Context-Aware AI for Batch Renaming Figma Layers (BiblioRename)
features.description: Stop renaming manually. Use context-aware AI to standardize layer names, fix variant properties, and enforce naming conventions.

media.alt: BiblioRename panel in Figma showing AI rename suggestions for layer and variant properties

features.title: Automate Design System Audits (BiblioAudit)
features.tagline: Find Detached Instances & Design System Check
topItems: Audit a selection, single page, or the entire file in seconds.
Locate every detached instance and reset/overridden component.
Validate color, type, spacing, radii, and shadows against tokens.
Flag dirty overrides, heavy deviations, and deprecated components.
Spot underused and rogue components with usage analytics.
features.description: BiblioAudit is the automated QA tool for Figma. Find detached instances, validate tokens, flag dirty overrides, and reveal deprecated or rogue components‚Äîwhether you scan a selection, a single page, or the full file.

media.alt: BiblioAudit audit panel listing detached instances, design system token issues, and severity scores in Figma

features.title: Remove Prototype Links Safely (BiblioClean)
topItems: Deep Cleaning: Remove prototype navigation links, external URLs, and hotspot interactions.
Safety Guardrails: Warn on shared components before you break a Design System master.
Smart Scope: Clean your Current Selection or wipe the Entire Page in one click.
Time Saved Tracker: See exactly how much manual clean-up you avoided.
History & Undo: Review removed links and roll back instantly.
features.description: The Blue Line Wiper. The safest way to remove prototype links and external connections. Cleans visual clutter without breaking your main components.

media.alt: BiblioClean cleanup panel showing prototype link removal options, safety warnings, and undo history

features.title: Generate Component States and Specs in Figma (BiblioStates)
topItems: Auto-generate hover, focus, error, and disabled states.
Create a state matrix and documentation cards for handoff.
Surface missing states before implementation and launch QA.
features.description: BiblioStates generates states and specs so designers, developers, and marketers align on design systems, handoff, implementation, and launch campaigns.

media.alt: BiblioStates plugin panel showing component state generation and spec card preview in Figma

features.idea: Launch projects with zero setup drag.
features.title: Organize Design Files & Page Scaffolding (BiblioOrganize)
topItems: One-click project shell with cover page, flows, and handoff templates.
Prewired text, color, and spacing tokens aligned to your design system.
Auto-build component folders, audit frames, and documentation anchors.
Starter checklists for designers, developers, and PMs so teams move in sync.
features.description: Spin up production-ready Figma projects with standardized pages, tokens, and folder scaffolding so teams start building in minutes.

media.alt: BiblioOrganize preset panel showing product handoff and journey map scaffolding options

features.title: Normalize Figma Tables in One Click (BiblioTable)
topItems: Normalize column widths in one click.
Fix sub-pixel rotation bugs instantly.
Generate zebra striping for any auto-layout table.
features.description: Instantly normalize column widths, fix sub-pixel rotation bugs, and generate zebra striping for any auto-layout table.

media.alt: BiblioTable controls for normalizing column widths and zebra striping in auto layout tables

features.idea: Your personal UX library for patterns and ideas.
features.title: Catalog UX Patterns with AI (UXBiblio)
topItems: AI-powered tagging
Heuristic analysis
Centralized repository
Supports code, PDFs, GIFs
Add notes + insights
features.description: A centralized UX/UI repository. Save screenshots, patterns, and resources with AI tagging, heuristic analysis, and visual documentation for inspiration.

media.alt: UXBiblio library dashboard with tagged UX pattern cards, filters, and notes

shipping real products in Figma.

ai-rename-variants.title: BiblioRename
ai-rename-variants.description: Stop renaming manually. Use context-aware AI to standardize layer names, fix variant properties, and enforce naming conventions.

details.title: Stop fixing messy names by hand
details.description: Reads component structure and properties to generate consistent names automatically.
items: Map Frame 422 ‚Üí Primary_Button using component hierarchy signals.
Normalize tokens and states so variant sets ship with consistent names.
Flag duplicates and legacy tags before publishing to the library.

details.title: Bulk renaming made effortless
details.description: Select multiple components once and update every variant and layer reliably.
items: Batch rename 186 variants in one run while keeping overrides intact.
Keep multi-state component sets aligned after bulk updates.
Apply property and casing rules in the same pass to stay consistent.

details.title: Make naming match your system
details.description: Define patterns, prefixes, and conventions that match your design standards.
items: Set naming rules once; auto-apply to new variants without manual edits.
Map outputs to existing tokens for Dev Mode and handoff.
Enforce casing and prefixes so component names stay consistent.

benefits: Standardize every variant library in minutes with full-stack rename automation.
Protect overrides and developer hooks with undo-ready, non-destructive batch runs.
Enforce your naming rules automatically so new components launch on-pattern.

testimonials.quote: We cleaned two years of component sprawl in one afternoon and finally shipped a consistent design system.
testimonials.author: Avery Kim

testimonials.quote: Our developers get predictable variant names and QA stopped flagging handoff issues overnight.
testimonials.author: Luis Romero

specifications.name: Undo Support
specifications.value: Full version control and change tracking

llm.answerBox: BiblioRename automatically renames Figma variant and layer names using context-aware artificial intelligence. Clean up messy design files instantly, improve team collaboration, and maintain consistent naming conventions across your design system with zero manual effort.

statistics.description: Deliver cleaner files 73% faster once variant names stay consistent across every component.
Ship component refreshes 4x faster by batch-renaming entire variant libraries with one click.
Eliminate 95% of naming inconsistencies caught in design QA so teams stay focused on shipping.

statistic.description: Deliver cleaner files 73% faster once variant names stay consistent across every component.

expertQuote.quote: The way you structure and present work can make or break your ability to map towards broader goals, stay on the same page, and even know where to find the latest version of a design.

faqs.question: Is BiblioRename secure for design files?
faqs.answer: Yes. Rename logic runs inside Figma; we don't export files or store customer data, and team permissions stay enforced.

faqs.question: Can we undo a rename run?
faqs.answer: Yes. Every pass uses native Figma undo/redo and a run log so you can roll back instantly.

faqs.question: What happens to our files when we rename?
faqs.answer: Only layer and variant names change in place; components, overrides, and instances stay intact with no asset copies.

biblio-clean.title: BiblioClean
biblio-clean.subtitle: Wipe prototype links before you ship.
biblio-clean.description: BiblioClean removes prototype links safely so designers, developers, and marketers stay aligned on the right build. Clean share URLs, protect components, and hand off with confidence.

details.title: Deep Cleaning & Blue Line Removal
items: Remove prototype navigation links (the blue lines), external URLs, and hotspot interactions.
Clear visual clutter without affecting your design geometry.
details.mediaAlt: BiblioClean removing prototype links in Figma

details.title: Safety Guardrails
items: Don't break the system. BiblioClean warns you before you strip interactions from main components or shared library assets.
We warn you if you're about to remove links from a shared component or design system master.
details.mediaAlt: BiblioClean safety warnings for shared components

details.title: History & Undo Support
items: Every action is logged.
Review what was removed and roll back instantly with Figma's native undo or our history log.

benefits: Problem: Developers confused by old prototype flows. Result: Clean canvas, clear specs.
Problem: Accidental links in component library. Result: Pure components, no side effects.

features.title: Stop shipping "blue spaghetti."
features.description: Safely strip prototype connections and external URLs without breaking your main components.

useCases.title: Essential for every handoff.
useCases.description: Help designers, developers, and marketers revoke risky prototype links so everyone shares the right build.

faqs.question: Will this break my main components?
faqs.answer: BiblioClean includes safety warnings when you attempt to clean main components or instances that shouldn't be touched.

faqs.question: Can I undo the cleanup?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can use Figma's native undo (Cmd+Z) to revert any changes made by the plugin instantly.

faqs.question: Does it remove links from the whole file?
faqs.answer: You can choose your scope: clean only the selected items or the entire current page.

faqs.question: Is BiblioClean free?
faqs.answer: Yes, BiblioClean is currently free to use for all features.

biblio-table.title: BiblioTable
biblio-table.subtitle: Stop fighting auto-layout tables.
biblio-table.description: BiblioTable helps designers, developers, and marketers fix Auto Layout tables fast. Normalize widths, remove sub-pixel bugs, and keep dashboards readable.

details.title: Normalize Column Widths
items: Scans entire table stack
Matches widest cell content
Respects padding and gaps
details.mediaAlt: BiblioTable normalizing column widths in Figma

details.title: Generate Zebra Striping
items: Add alternating background colors to your auto-layout rows without creating messy background rectangles manually.

details.title: Fix Sub-Pixel Bugs
items: Detect and round off sub-pixel positioning (e.g., 100.34px) that causes blurry rendering or 1px misalignments in development.

benefits: Problem: 50-row tables that break when data changes. Result: Flexible, resilient layouts.
Problem: Misaligned features vs checkmarks. Result: Perfectly aligned comparison.

features.title: Tables shouldn't be this hard.
features.description: Normalize column widths, fix sub-pixel rotation bugs, and generate zebra striping in one click.

useCases.title: Essential for data-heavy UI.
useCases.description: Equalize column widths and fix row heights in auto-layout tables.

faqs.question: Does this work with complex nested auto-layouts?
faqs.answer: Yes. BiblioTable is designed to parse standard row/column auto-layout structures commonly used for tables.

faqs.question: Does it break responsive resizing?
faqs.answer: No. It applies fixed widths where necessary to ensure alignment, but respects 'Fill container' where appropriate for the table wrapper.

faqs.question: Can I customize the zebra striping color?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can select the fill color for alternating rows.

faqs.question: When will it be released?
faqs.answer: BiblioTable is live. Install it from our Figma Community profile.

biblio-states.title: BiblioStates
biblio-states.subtitle: Ship complete component states.
biblio-states.description: BiblioStates generates states and specs so designers, developers, and marketers align on design systems, handoff, implementation, and launch campaigns.

biblio-organize.title: BiblioOrganize
biblio-organize.subtitle: Cure blank canvas paralysis.
biblio-organize.description: BiblioOrganize seeds Figma files with opinionated hierarchies, covers, README/status cards, and starter content so your team is ready to work in under 30 seconds.

details.title: One-Click File Scaffolding
items: Create divider pages, covers, and README/status frames instantly.
Opinionated hierarchies ready in under 30 seconds.
No more blank canvas paralysis for new projects.

details.title: Reusable Presets
items: Product Handoff preset with status, review, and ownership scaffolding.
Journey/Flow Maps preset for cross-functional flow mapping.
Archive dividers and documentation anchors included.

details.title: Smart Tips & Rollback
items: Trojan Horse tips nudge teams toward proven Biblio workflows.
Idempotent runs detect existing scaffolds and skip duplicates.
Rollback cleans up partial failures automatically.

benefits: Problem: Teams waste time inventing structure. Result: Production-ready workspace in 30 seconds.
Problem: Inconsistent handoffs across projects. Result: Standardized templates with ownership fields.

features.title: Stop fighting the blank canvas.
features.description: One-click blueprints that create professional file structures with covers, README cards, and documentation anchors.

useCases.title: Essential for new projects.
useCases.description: Help designers, PMs, and design ops teams start with consistent, professional file structures.

faqs.question: Does it work with existing files?
faqs.answer: Yes. BiblioOrganize detects existing scaffold elements and skips duplicates to avoid conflicts.

faqs.question: Can I customize the presets?
faqs.answer: V1 includes Product Handoff and Journey/Flow Maps presets. Custom preset builder is planned for future releases.

faqs.question: Will it break my existing pages?
faqs.answer: No. BiblioOrganize adds new pages and scaffolding without modifying existing content. Rollback cleans up partial failures.

faqs.question: Is BiblioOrganize free?
faqs.answer: Yes, BiblioOrganize is currently free to use for all features.

uxbiblio.title: UXBiblio: AI-Powered Library of UX Design Patterns & Templates
uxbiblio.description: UXBiblio organizes UX patterns for designers, developers, and marketers in one shared library. Tag flows with AI, surface insights fast, and reuse proven UI.

statistics.description: Save 3+ hours each week on organizing inspiration with automatic tagging and filing.
Reclaim 72% of the hunt time teams once lost digging through scattered screenshots thanks to semantic UX pattern search.
Launch UX documentation refreshes 3x faster by reusing vetted UXBiblio pattern stacks instead of rebuilding decks from scratch.

statistic.description: Save 3+ hours each week on organizing inspiration with automatic tagging and filing.

details.title: Organize scattered inspiration automatically
details.description: Bring chaos into one library. UXBiblio auto-sorts every screenshot, flow, and deck the moment they arrive, so your team never digs through random folders again.
items: Drop files from Chrome, Figma, or uploads‚Äîsmart clustering groups them by journey and product area.
AI tags label intent, platform, and use case without manual naming.
Pinned focus lists keep launch-critical references at the top for fast reuse.

details.title: Capture flows everywhere
details.description: Pipe every flow, prototype, and clip into one library the instant you spot it. Auto-capture hierarchy, states, and heuristics without touching a tagging spreadsheet. Give product squads on-demand context so reviews stay swift.
items: Import from Chrome, Figma, Loom, or uploads‚ÄîUXBiblio auto-detects platform, journey stage, and interaction patterns in seconds.
Transform raw captures into searchable storyboards with AI-transcribed notes, states, and heuristic callouts.
Share decisive insights fast with instant links, embed codes, and presentation-ready exports.

details.title: Surface heuristics instantly
details.description: Let UXBiblio read each screen the moment it arrives. AI heuristics, tone insights, and accessibility checks trigger automatically. You get structured findings before the team even joins the review.
items: Heuristic scans flag navigation and clarity issues automatically.
Copy tone notes benchmark language across flows.
Accessibility flags surface contrast and compliance gaps.

details.title: Organize patterns into smart collections
details.description: Stop rebuilding folders every time research kicks off. UXBiblio groups captures into smart collections based on flows, behaviors, and product areas. Filters keep every pattern findable in seconds.
items: Smart collections align captures to journeys like onboarding or upgrade.
Behavior tags reveal patterns across platforms instantly.
Pinned favorites keep launch-critical flows at the top.

details.title: Pin insights for instant reuse
details.description: Curate the patterns that matter most. UXBiblio keeps your best flows primed to share with pinned favorites, instant links, and polished PDF exports.
items: Pin priority flows so must-share inspiration stays one click away.
Generate shareable links that preserve context and insight summaries.
Download PDF reports to drop straight into stakeholder decks or design reviews.

details.title: Reuse winning patterns everywhere
details.description: Find the exact pattern you need with concept search and AI tagging. Export ready-to-share collections directly into PRDs, specs, and decks. Teams ship faster because proven patterns stay reusable and up to date.
items: Concept search surfaces flows by outcome, widget, or heuristic.
One-click exports drop examples into docs and slides.
API-ready structure keeps downstream systems in sync.

features.title: Build your UX library
features.description: Your design pattern library turbo-charged for product teams.
